WaveShaperNodeOversample.summary: The oversample property of the interface is an enumerated value indicating if oversampling must be used. Oversampling is a technique for creating more samples (up-sampling) before applying a distortion effect to the audio signal.

remarks.para: Once applied, the number of samples is reduced to its initial numbers. This leads to better results by avoiding some aliasing, but comes at the expense of a lower precision shaping curve.

td.para: Double the amount of samples before applying the shaping curve.
Multiply by 4 the amount of samples before applying the shaping curve.
